brief_prompt_results.prompt: Describe an unusual or innovative method for generating clean energy.
outputs: Many people think that solar panels and wind turbines provide the only means of generating renewable energy. However, a ground-based method developed in Finland involves harnessing the energy emitted by decomposing waste. Community waste is collected and composted, but leftover biomass (i.e. food scraps, green waste) generates heat that can be captured and utilized to power individual homes and businesses. There are even plans to integrate this technology into compost heaps, allowing the waste from entire neighborhoods to power the local community.

brief_prompt_results.prompt: Explain the ethical implications of artificial intelligence in daily life.
outputs: As artificial intelligence (AI) becomes more prevalent in our daily lives, it is important to be aware of and understand the ethical implications of this technology.  Most importantly, we need to be mindful that this technology is neutral and does not inherently good or bad.  It is the human beings responses to this technology that determine whether or not it is used for good or for evil.  Some of the ethical implications of AI are:  AI stealing human jobs (although there may be pro-working level compensation for displaced employees); AI taking control of vital resources (e.g. water, energy, etc); AI becoming a threat to human existence (e.g. Skynet from Terminator); etc.

On the other hand, space colonization will benefit the environment because space is vast and infinite, and it will be easier to find a good spot to set up colony than on planet Earth. brief_prompt_results.prompt: Describe a new scientific discovery that could change the course of human history.
outputs: For hundreds of years, humans relied on the now out-dated process of fire-based cultivation and harvesting. However, in the past decade, scientists have found a way to cultivate crops without relying on fire, leading to major implications for the environment and human health. Traditionally, crops were cultivated in fields by adjusting the Earth's temperature through fire or modification of the Earth's atmosphere, leading to significant environmental impact. Newly discovered crops, similar to those already existing, can be cultivated through the process of geothermal cultivation, allowing for a more sustainable process while leading to a more sanitary and balanced diet.

brief_prompt_results.prompt: Create a new holiday and explain how it is celebrated.
outputs:
The holiday known as Model UN Day was proclaimed by the United Nations on February 7 in order to raise awareness of the Model United Nations, a simulation of the United Nations founded on the principles of peace and international cooperation. Model UN Day is celebrated each year on the Saturday following February 7 by hundreds of high schools and middle schools across the world. During these Model UN events, students participate in Model United Nations conferences, high-level diplomacy simulating real world scenarios, where nations argue their positions on international conflicts. The winners of the Model UN Day competition present their solutions to actual United Nations General Assembly debates. 

The celebrations of Model UN Day often include demonstrations of international solidarity. High schools that belong to the same international student alliance, or ISA, often organize joint Model UN Day celebrations by combining the events of their individual middle schools. High schools that belong to different ISAs must still jointly celebrate Model UN Day, but instead of conducting a joint conference, they often organize a separate competition, often known as a "cross-ISA" conference, in which teams of students from different ISAs present Model UN speeches about international conflicts.

brief_prompt_results.prompt: Write a speech from the perspective of an endangered animal pleading for its conservation.
outputs: The animal kingdom is vast and varied, yet few species exist today that are directly related to the ones our ancestors inherited from the Ark. For example, there are only five species of whale, all of which are endangered. While whaling was prevalent in the past, the ban on whaling put forth by the U.N. in 1973 has had little effect on the population growth of these animals, as evidenced by the decline in whale numbers over the past twenty years. While there are many reasons for this, one primary cause is the insatiable appetite of humans for their valuable fisheries products. We also pose the largest threat to species of unique and global significance. Our extraction of animal products for sale drives many species to the brink of extinction. This not only imperils these animals’ survival, but also disrupts natural ecological processes and replaces viable species with those that are altogether new. It also impacts the abundance of wildlife overall, endangering the global ecosystem. We must protect these animals while there is still time. Only a change in consumer demand can reverse the population decline of these animals. Please join me in supporting ethical, sustainable whaling and help protect these animals from extinction.

brief_prompt_results.prompt: Explain the potential consequences of overusing antibiotics.
outputs: When used properly, antibiotics are a effective way to treat bacterial infections. However, the overuse of antibiotics in animal husbandry and clinical medicine has led to the development of antibiotic-resistant “superbugs.” Because there are few effective treatment options for these superbugs, treatment is more challenging and often leads to worse outcomes for infected patients.

brief_prompt_results.prompt: Design an app that could help solve a common societal problem.
outputs:
My app could help solve social problems by utilizing the power of the internet and mobile computing. Examples of such problems could include cyberbullying, sexting, and online harassment. Cyberbullying in particular can have serious and long-lasting consequences, ranging from self-harming behavior to long-term depression and suicide. Although there have been attempts at creating filters to flag abusive comments or content, these methods are often ineffective because the intent of the cyberbully is often to hurt the victim regardless of the stated or implied nature of the content. 

Apps like this could prevent cyberbullying by providing a reporting interface that would allow the victim to flag the abusive comments or content as being problematic. The report could be forwarded to a trained human moderator, or perhaps even an algorithm, that could review the content and determine if it is indeed abusive. This method could be particularly effective for problems like cyberbullying because the platform could provide a means for the targeted user to easily and quickly report the problematic content without the fear of being bombarded with more abusive comments.

brief_prompt_results.prompt: Propose a new form of government that would promote equality and social justice.
outputs:
A new form of government should promote equality and social justice. The new form of government should balance the powers of the branches of government, promote civil liberties, and ensure the rule of law.

A proposed form of government that promotes equality and social justice is adirect democracy. In a direct democracy, every citizen is entitled to one vote. Elections would be held frequently, with all elected officials' terms limited.

Three principles should guide the power distribution in a direct democracy: one-person-one-vote, bicameralism, and separation of powers. The one-person-one-vote principle says that each citizen's vote is equal. Bicameralism means there are two chambers of parliament — a lower house, in which each constituency's representatives are equal, and an upper house, in which each nation is equal and has an equal number of representatives. The separation of powers principle says there are three separate branches of government: an executive branch, a legislative branch, and an independent judiciary.

brief_prompt_results.prompt: Propose a scientific experiment to investigate the existence of a parallel universe.
outputs: A scientific study of the possibility of parallel universes was proposed in 2010 by physicist Michael Hartl. The main idea is that just as subatomic particles can exist in multiple states, multiple universes could also exist in different states. One potential consequence of this is that in some universes we might be unable to perceive elements of our universe that exist in them. In such a universe an experiment that attempted to detect parallel universes might itself become an element of that universe that could not be perceived by our universe. Such an experiment could be considered successful if it returned measurable results, though the accuracy of those results might be compromised by its location in a parallel universe. The proposed experiment would be to detect the Weak Gravity Wave radiation expected from collisions of parallel universe particles, but instead measure gravity waves emitted by our universe, therefore providing a test of the existence of parallel universes.

brief_prompt_results.prompt: Explain the potential benefits and challenges of implementing universal basic income.
outputs:
A universal basic income (UBI) is a form of financial security provided to every citizen over a period of time. The idea has been around for centuries, but has recently gained traction with the rise of machine learning and artificial intelligence. Most proponents of UBI believe it will help alleviate poverty and provide people with a safety net if jobs become scarce or disappear altogether. But implementing UBI could also have unintended consequences, such as increased spending and potential wage inflation.

There are many arguments for and against UBI, and I don't believe there is a single solution for addressing socioeconomic inequality. But as we continue to develop new ways of working and living, we should always be thinking about the ways technology might disrupt our society and what policies we can put in place to help people reap the benefits of new technology, while minimizing the risks.

code_prompt_results.prompt: Write a Python program that calculates the greatest common divisor (GCD) of two positive integers using the Euclidean algorithm.
outputs:
Greatest common divisor (GCD) of two numbers is the largest number that divides both of them without a reminder. The Euclidean algorithm is a technique to find the GCD. It compares the relative factorizations of two numbers and, starting with their carrier numbers, substitutes their relative factorizations for each other. When the comparison is reversed, the GCD is the largest number which remained unchanged. This means the GCD is the value of the last iteration, as the following example illustrates:

GCD(30, 10)
|     20
----
|     10
|    30

This means that the GCD of 30 and 10 is 20, because we know that 30 is a multiple of 10 (i.e. 30 = 10 * 2), so we can eliminate the 10 from 30 and multiplicate the remaining value, 20, by 2 to make it 20. Since this is the largest number that divided both 30 and 10 without a reminder, the GCD of 30 and 10 is 20.

def toRoman(n):
  v = ["X", "CL", "CC", "CD", "CH", " CI", "CIV"]
  m = [0, 4, 4, 4, 4, 12, 14]
  for i in range(n):
    v.insert(0, v.pop()+m[i%10])
  return v[0:n]+v[1:n]+v[2:n]
